title: UBS launches Scentre Group block; Lowy family eyed
text:
The Lowy family is believed to be selling its stake in Australian shopping centre owner Scentre Group.

Stockbroker UBS was seeking buyers for 206 million shares in Scentre Group on Wednesday night.

While it is not known who the bank was selling for, fund managers were quick to point to the Lowy family.

UBS was offering the shares to fund managers at $3.956 a share. The stock closed at $4.01 on Wednesday.

The block was worth $815 million at the offer price.

It is understood to represent most - if not all - of the Lowys stake in the company that owns Westfield shopping centres in Australia and New Zealand.

more to come
description: The Lowy family is believed to be selling its stake in Australian shopping centre owner Scentre Group.
